displaytitle: Mrs. Siddons in the Character of the Tragic Muse
creditline: Gift of Alexander P. Morgan, Class of 1922
inscribed:
Printed below plate, lower left and right corners: Sr. Joshua Reynolds pinxt. / Frans Haward A. R. sculpt.

Printed caption, lower center: MRS. SIDDONS in the Character of the Tragic Muse. / To the KING’S most Excellent MAJESTY this Plate is humbly inscrib’d by Permission with all Gratitude & Respect, / by his most dutiful Subject & Servant, Francis Haward. 

Printed along lower edge, from left to right: Printed by C. F. Gouthier / London publish’d June 4th 1787, by Frans Haward, N. 29, March Street, Lambeth, near the Turnpike.

titles.title: Mrs. Siddons in the Character of the Tragic Muse

makers.displaydate: 1723–1792; born Plympton, England; died London, England
makers.displaymaker: after Sir Joshua Reynolds, 1723–1792; born Plympton, England; died London, England
Printed by Gouthier, French, active late 18th century

texts.textentryhtml: In the era before mechanical or photographic reproduction, the fame of an artist's painting and the reputation of its subject were spread though the publication and collection of fine reproductive prints, such as this engraving after a painting by Sir Joshua Reynolds. The captivating Sarah Siddons (1775-1835) was the best-known tragic actress on the British stage in the eighteenth century, famous for her Shakespearean roles such as Lady Macbeth, Desdemona, and Ophelia. Her portrait in The Character of the Tragic Muse was painted by Sir Joshua Reynolds in 1784 and reproduced as an engraving by Haward three years later.

bibliography.boilertext: Alfreda J. Murck, "Acquisitions 1968", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 27, no. 2 (1968): p. 94-105.
